intro: Polyactium flavum, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its yellow flowers bloom in spring, and the leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
